TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit MessageWriter extends System.IO.StringWriter

Docs.summary: MessageWriter is the abstract base for classes that write constraint descriptions and messages in some form. The class has separate methods for writing various components of a message, allowing implementations to tailor the presentation as needed.

MemberSignature.Value: protected MessageWriter ();
.method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Construct a MessageWriter given a culture

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void DisplayDifferences (NUnit.Framework.Constraints.Constraint constraint);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void DisplayDifferences(class NUnit.Framework.Constraints.Constraint constraint) cil managed

Docs.summary: Display Expected and Actual lines for a constraint. This is called by MessageWriter's default implementation of WriteMessageTo and provides the generic two-line display.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void DisplayDifferences (object expected, object actual);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void DisplayDifferences(object expected, object actual) cil managed

Docs.param: The actual value causing the failure
Docs.summary: Display Expected and Actual lines for given values. This method may be called by constraints that need more control over the display of actual and expected values than is provided by the default implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void DisplayDifferences (object expected, object actual, NUnit.Framework.Constraints.Tolerance tolerance);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void DisplayDifferences(object expected, object actual, class NUnit.Framework.Constraints.Tolerance tolerance) cil managed

Docs.param: The actual value causing the failure
The tolerance within which the test was made
Docs.summary: Display Expected and Actual lines for given values, including a tolerance value on the Expected line.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void DisplayStringDifferences (string expected, string actual, int mismatch, bool ignoreCase, bool clipping);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void DisplayStringDifferences(string expected, string actual, int32 mismatch, bool ignoreCase, bool clipping) cil managed

Docs.param: The point at which the strings don't match or -1
If true, case is ignored in locating the point where the strings differ
If true, the strings should be clipped to fit the line
Docs.summary: Display the expected and actual string values on separate lines. If the mismatch parameter is >=0, an additional line is displayed line containing a caret that points to the mismatch point.
